chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Karron D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amout remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil  judgment.

In Wisconsin State Prison
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any current sentence defendant is currently serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karron D Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Karron D Smith in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant IN CUSTODY.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):   Statements made by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to the Wisconsin State Prison for a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 9 MONTHS, concurrent to any current sentence defendant is currently serving, with credit for ZERO days time served.  

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
FILED, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Karron D Smith in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.
Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court AMENDED Count 1 to Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 946.41(1)(a).

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Karron D Smith in court with attorney Jeffrey T. Wilson.  Defendant Karron D Smith in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.

Squad video discovery was just recently received by defense.
Also, on defense's witness list recently filed, there is a witness listed that may need a notice of alibi filed.
State requests an adjournment of the trial.
No objections.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 07-21-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Jury Trial.

Defendant Karron D Smith in court with attorney Jeffrey T. Wilson.  Defendant Karron D Smith IN CUSTODY.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a Final Pretrial Conference.
Parties advised the Court that they have not yet reached an agreement.
Statements made.
Jury trial date scheduled on 04-07-2014 at 8:30 AM to remain on the Court's calendar.
filed by Atty. Jeff Wilson on behalf of the defendant.
filed by Atty. Jeff Wilson on behalf of the defendant.
"UPDATED" and Response to State's Discovery Demand filed by Atty. Jeff Wilson on behalf of the defendant.

Attorney Jeffrey T Wilson in court, defendant Karron D Smith not in court, IN CUSTODY.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties request a Final Pretrial Conference AND Jury Trial dates.  
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 03-17-2014 at 1:30 PM for Final Pre-Trial Conference AND 04-07-2014 at 8:30 AM for Jury Trial - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Pretrial Scheduling Order.

Defendant Karron D Smith in court with attorney Jeffrey T Wilson.  Defendant Karron D Smith in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Adkins-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Karron D Smith in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Karron D Smith in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
